intro: Acmella filipes, commonly known as the threadleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by livestock and wildlife.
